name: 西洋翻譯史專題研究
description: The purpose of this course is to introduce students to Greek tragedy and to provide them with some notion of the vast influence that Greek tragedy has had on world literature. In the first half of the course, we will read tragedies by the three Greek playwrights Aeschylus, Sophocles, and Euripides. In the second half of the course, we will read several plays that have been influenced either directly or indirectly by Greek tragedy. In particular, we will read plays written by Seneca, Shakespeare, Racine, Cao Yu, and Arthur Miller.
goals: Students will learn the general history of the translation of the Bible.
Students will learn of the origins and development of the New Testament.
Students will learn how the King James Bible changed a nation, a language, and a culture.
Students will learn how the translation of the Bible helped to spread Christianity in China.
syllabus: 本課程旨在探討《新約聖經》，共分為兩大部分。（1）《新約聖經》: 我們將閱讀並討論《新約聖經》的「福音書」、「使徒行傳」、「保羅書信」、「大公書信」和「啟示錄」。（2）與《新約聖經》翻譯相關的議題。我們將探討的主題包括《七十士譯本》如何影響《新約聖經》的形成、宗教改革與聖經翻譯間的關係、欽定版聖經的歷史與背景，以及《和合本》的形成與影響。
